objectives: Learner can describe complex motion paths
Learner can use prefixes to express crossing, passing, stopping by
Learner can give and follow directional instructions

sections.name: Summary
sections.content:
Today you learned advanced motion prefixes:

| Prefix | Core Meaning | Example |
|--------|--------------|---------|
| **Ğ¿ĞµÑ€Ğµ-** | across, over | Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ¹Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ²ÑƒĞ»Ğ¸Ñ†Ñ |
| **Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾-** | through, past | Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğº |
| **Ğ·Ğ°-** | behind, stopping by | Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ² Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ³Ğ°Ğ·Ğ¸Ğ½ |
| **Ğ´Ğ¾-** | reaching destination | Ğ´Ñ–Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ´Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ€ĞºÑƒ |
| **Ğ¾Ğ±-** | around | Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ–Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ğ·ĞµÑ€Ğ¾ |
| **Ğ¿Ñ–Ğ´-** | approaching | Ğ¿Ñ–Ğ´Ñ–Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ±Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ¶Ñ‡Ğµ |

These prefixes combine with motion verbs to create precise navigation instructions.

---

## Warm-up

In A1, you learned basic motion verbs (Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğ¸, Ñ—Ñ…Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸). In earlier A2 modules, you learned simple prefixes.

Now we go deeper into **advanced motion prefixes** that describe complex paths:
- **Ğ¿ĞµÑ€Ğµ-** = across, over, re-
- **Ğ·Ğ°-** = behind, stopping by, beginning
- **Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾-** = through, past
- **Ğ¿Ñ–Ğ´-** = approach from below
- **Ğ¾Ğ±-** = around
- **Ğ´Ğ¾-** = reaching the destination

These prefixes transform simple motion into precise navigation. After this module, you'll give directions like a local!

Motion prefixes are essential for everyday communication. When you give directions, describe your commute, or tell travel stories, you need these prefixes to be accurate. English uses prepositions for this purpose, but Ukrainian embeds the path information directly into the verb. This is both elegant and efficient.


**Why This Matters:**

Understanding motion prefixes is crucial for navigating Ukrainian cities, following directions, and describing your daily routines. While English uses separate prepositions (across, through, around), Ukrainian integrates these meanings directly into the verb through prefixes. This makes Ukrainian more concise but requires mastering the prefix system.

Each prefix creates a distinct mental image of the path taken. When you hear "Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ¹Ñ‚Ğ¸," you should visualize crossing from one side to another. When you hear "Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ–Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğ¸," imagine walking around something in a circle. This visualization technique is key to mastering motion verbs.



---

## Prefix Group 1: Crossing & Through

## ĞŸĞµÑ€Ğµ- (Across, Over, Re-)

| Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµÑ—Ñ…Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸ | to cross by vehicle | ĞœĞ¸ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµÑ—Ñ…Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ¼Ñ–ÑÑ‚. |
| Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ¿Ğ»Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ¸ | to swim across | Ğ’Ñ–Ğ½ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ¿Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ² Ñ€Ñ–Ñ‡ĞºÑƒ. |

**Related Meanings:**
- Ğ¿ĞµÑ€Ğµ- can also mean "re-" (doing again): Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµÑ€Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ¸ = to redo

## Deep Dive: Prefix Combinations

Advanced speakers combine prefixes for even more precise meanings. Here are some examples you may encounter:

**Ğ’Ğ¸ + Ğ·Ğ° = Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğ¸ + Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğ¸ (Exit and enter):**

**ĞŸÑ€Ğ¾ + Ğ¿ĞµÑ€Ğµ = Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ—Ñ…Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸ + Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµÑ—Ñ…Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸ (Pass through and cross):**
- ĞœĞ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ—Ñ…Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ¼Ñ–ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ñ– Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµÑ—Ñ…Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ¼Ñ–ÑÑ‚. (We drove through the city and crossed the bridge.)

**ĞŸÑ–Ğ´ + Ğ´Ğ¾ = Ğ¿Ñ–Ğ´Ñ–Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğ¸ + Ğ´Ñ–Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğ¸ (Approach and reach):**
- Ğ’Ñ–Ğ½ Ğ¿Ñ–Ğ´Ñ–Ğ¹ÑˆĞ¾Ğ² Ğ´Ğ¾ Ğ´Ğ²ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ¹ Ñ– Ğ´Ñ–Ğ¹ÑˆĞ¾Ğ² Ğ´Ğ¾ ĞºĞ°Ğ±Ñ–Ğ½ĞµÑ‚Ñƒ. (He approached the door and reached the office.)

Understanding these combinations will help you describe complex journeys with precision. This is an advanced skill that develops with time and practice.

## Language Learning Tip

Motion prefix mastery comes from visualization. For each prefix, create a mental image of the path:

- **Ğ¿ĞµÑ€Ğµ-** = imagine a bridge crossing a river
- **Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾-** = imagine walking through a tunnel
- **Ğ·Ğ°-** = imagine going behind a building
- **Ğ¾Ğ±-** = imagine walking around a lake
- **Ğ´Ğ¾-** = imagine reaching a flag at the finish line
- **Ğ¿Ñ–Ğ´-** = imagine approaching a platform from below

When you hear a motion verb, visualize the path first. This will help you understand and produce the correct prefix naturally.
